intro: Ouratea thonneri, commonly known as the Brazilian holly, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic rainforests of Brazil. It is a member of the Ochnaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy appearance. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, hard seeds.
